verb.description: Feel sad, repentant, or disappointed over (something that has happened or been done, especially a loss or missed opportunity)
examples: I regretted that he did not see you

noun.description: A feeling of sadness, repentance, or disappointment over something that has happened or been done.
examples: she expressed her regret at Virginia's death
he had to decline, to his regret

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French regreter bewail (the dead), perhaps from the Germanic base of greet.
